de.luis.kioskComponents.ePayment

Interface PayTransaction


  • public interface PayTransaction
    Project: LUIS ePayment

    The payment transaction is a two step thing. Step one is to start the transaction, whereas step two finishes it. Like in databases, this finishing has two endings:

    • The transaction will be committed
    • The transaction will be rolled back
    After a trasaction is started, a new instance of a PayTransaction object is created. This instance allows a commit or rollback of the transaction. But you don't have to waste time. After some time (in many payment terminals it are only 3 minutes) the payment terminal will automatically rollback its transaction. The trasaction will also get rolled back, if you start something new (eg. a cash crop). So its a good advice to commit/rollback the transaction within the next minute.

    Many application use this 2-step transaction to print their receipt. If this printing fails or if the delivery of the payed goods turns out to have some problems, then the whole payment transaction can be cancelled. The first step checks the payment media, checks the network provider and checks the fund of the transaction against the given card. If something went wrong, you will never get a PayTransaction instance, but a PayException.

    Before the second step, one can check the hardware, print the bill, do something with the goods. And only then one can commit or rollback the transaction.

    But use a timer in order not to run out of time and the payment terminal starts an automatic cancellation by itself.

    Version:
    $Revision: 1.5 $
    Author:
    M. Gelfort

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void commit(PayMedia media)
      This method commitsa given transaction.
      boolean isCommitted()
      Flag for the result of a closed transaction.
      boolean isOpen()
      This flag signals a still open transaction, i.e. a transaction, that is not comitted and not rolled back.
      void rollback(PayMedia media)
      This method rolls back a given transaction.

    • Method Detail

      • commit

        void commit(PayMedia media)
     throws PayException
        This method commitsa given transaction. In every case, the PayMedia parameter gets filled with informations about the card used for payment.
        Parameters:
        media - Returns informations about the card used for payment.
        Throws:
        PayException

      • rollback

        void rollback(PayMedia media)
       throws PayException
        This method rolls back a given transaction. In every case, the PayMedia parameter gets filled with informations about the card used for payment. Since version 4.3 the method no longer throws an AbortException, if the rollback is successfull. It returns void now, if successfull.
        Parameters:
        media - Returns informations about the card used for payment.
        Throws:
        PayException

      • isOpen

        boolean isOpen()
        This flag signals a still open transaction, i.e. a transaction, that is not comitted and not rolled back.
        Returns:
        boolean flag for a non committed and non rolled-back transaction.

      • isCommitted

        boolean isCommitted()
        Flag for the result of a closed transaction.
        Returns:
        true, if the transaction was closed AND was closed by committing; false otherwise.
